intro: Vriesea diantha, commonly known as the pink vriesea, is a species of flowering plant in the Bromeliaceae family. It is native to Brazil and is characterized by its striking, colorful inflorescence that features vibrant pink and red hues. The plant has a rosette-shaped foliage composed of long, narrow, evergreen leaves that are often covered in a waxy coating. It produces showy, pendulous flowers that bloom in late summer or early autumn. Vriesea diantha is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its ornamental value and ability to thrive in indirect light conditions.
